title-group.article-title: Financial Differences between Large and Small Firms

abstract.p: The vast majority of empirical research uses the large corporation as the basis for drawing inference. This paper presents the results of a study identifying the dissimilar financial characteristics of large publicly-owned corporations and small growth businesses. The findings suggest that certain disparities definitely exist, implying that the financial management of the small business is inherently different in several respects.
